newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian OLO exchange auction totals 4.98 bln bfr.
newsitem.headline: Belgian OLO exchange auction totals 4.98 bln bfr.

text.p: The Belgian Treasury said its linear government bond (OLO) exchange auction totalled 4.98 billion Belgian francs.
Volume offered was just 4.98 billion, which was all taken by the Treasury.

The Treasury was offering OLOs 27 (4.00 pct, Jan 2000), 25 (5.00 pct, March 2001), 6 (9.00 pct, March 2003), 19 (6.50 pct, March 2005) and 26 (6.25 pct, March 2007) against OLO 4 (9.25 pct, Jan 1998).

Volume at the auction was down sharply from previous auctions this year, which raised between 10 and 60 billion francs. A Treasury official said he saw no special reason why banks had offered so little volume at the auction.
The January 1998 OLO 4's expiry is still far away, however, giving the Treasury ample time to reduce the 145 billion francs still outstanding in the bond.
At the exchange auctions, banks can acquire new OLOs with other OLOs that are close to maturity.
